DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effectiveness two different psychosocial therapy , parent management training collaborative problem solving , treat child oppositional-defiant disorder .
DOC.brief_title: Comparison Two Psychosocial Therapies Treating Children With Oppositional-Defiant Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: Oppositional-defiant disorder ( ODD ) characterize recurrent pattern developmentally inappropriate level negative , defiant , disobedient , hostile behavior toward authority figure . Behaviors associate ODD include temper tantrum ; persistent stubbornness ; resistance direction ; unwillingness compromise , give , negotiate ; deliberate persistent test limit ; verbal minor physical aggression . The usual treatment approach child ODD parent management training ( PMT ) . PMT primarily involve teach parent strategy respond consistently correctly child 's behavior . However , PMT always lead longstanding result need alternative treatment . Collaborative problem-solving ( CPS ) treatment approach involve parent child teach parent help child control emotion problem-solve family . This study compare effectiveness CPS PMT treat child ODD . Participants open-label study include child ODD parent . Participants randomly assign one three group : CPS , PMT , waitlist control . Parents assign CPS group teach strategy help child identify regulate emotion solve behavior problem together family . Parents assign PMT group teach respond consistently appropriately child 's positive negative behavior . Participants assigned waitlist control condition group wait 10 week treatment begin . Participants attend 1-hour treatment session week 10 week . In order determine whether treatment effective , participant ask complete variety questionnaire , talk child solve problem , complete structure diagnostic interview prior begin treatment , follow treatment , 1-year follow-up session . Parents ask submit child 's school grade school attendance record . If grant permission parent , child 's teacher complete questionnaire regard child 's behavior school year prior participate study 1 year treatment . The information collect help determine treatment affect child 's progress .
